article.title: Lockheed Martin Awarded GPS Anti-Spoofing Contract Modification
article.text: Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control, Orlando, Fla., has been awarded a $10,185,912 cost-plus-fixed-fee modification (P00017) for an existing contract (FA8682-12-C-0006) for Joint Air-to-Surface Strategic Missile anti-jam GPS receiver-Selective Availability Anti-Spoofing Module Version 3 (JAGR-S V3) for development of the JAGR-S V3 and options for V3 Qualification Failure Review Board (FRB), V3 Flight Test FRB, and for the transit case assembly. Air Force Life Cycle Management Center/EBJK, Eglin Air Force Base, Fla., is the contracting activity.
